*div1 type="summary"* *p*Robert Wilson to Austin, Matamoros, September 36, 1830. Debates in Parliament concerning Texas aroused fears of American designs on Texas.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*Mattamoras */location_mentioned**date_mentioned n="09-16-1830">16th Sept 1830*/date_mentioned**/p* *p**person_mentioned*Col. S. F. Austin*/person_mentioned**/p*
*p*My Valued Friend I have been in this place for sometime waiting on the vessel, which is promised freight— I calculate to sail in a few days,*/p*
*p*I was Kindly received In this place by *person_mentioned*General Terran*/person_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Col Bradburn */person_mentioned*and others,*/p*
*p*We Expect to be full of *person_mentioned*Troops */person_mentioned*for the*location_mentioned* Trinity Station*/location_mentioned*, *person_mentioned*Col. Bradburn*/person_mentioned*, the *person_mentioned*Commander */person_mentioned*etc—with whom I am pleased *person_mentioned*General Terran*/person_mentioned* will march by land, shortly,*/p*
*p**location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*begins to Excite Much Interest It appears to me, and many think with me, that It must be aplace, of Peace and Safety— Considering the great difficulties in the Government— I have positively stated our faithfulness towards the Government, and that there is nothing to fear from the *person_mentioned*Americans*/person_mentioned*, Provided they Are believed, And not Imposed upon—we are Viewed with a Jealous Eye, In *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*Owing to the Jealousy of *location_mentioned*England*/location_mentioned*, I have seen a*location_mentioned* New York paper*/location_mentioned*, Containing the debates in *location_mentioned*Parliarment*/location_mentioned*, By *person_mentioned*Huskisson Bearing Peal*/person_mentioned*, and others—who toutch hard on us—Calling us *person_mentioned*squatters*/person_mentioned*. Turbulent, and an ungovernable sett—and show the *person_mentioned*United States*/person_mentioned*, as Reaching for the *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*— I hope you have or will see the papers— But Sir we are safe, in *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*Only let the *person_mentioned*Cittizens */person_mentioned*be true to their Contracts, notwithstanding, the Jealouses of the Governments—*/p*
*p*I now Sir, before I close ask a favour of you. It is this, a *person_mentioned*Mrs Reed, of *location_mentioned*New Orleans*/location_mentioned**/person_mentioned* was pleased with the discription which others and myself gave her of *location_mentioned*Texas */location_mentioned*she, agreed and vissitted. In *date_mentioned n="07-xx-1830">July last*/date_mentioned*—and Intended to have seen you--but understanding you was not *location_mentioned*home */location_mentioned*she declined— her Intention was to get land, and as she has a *person_mentioned*family */person_mentioned*and will be a Valuable *person_mentioned*Cittizen*/person_mentioned*, I ask for her, She stated to me, that she had written to you on the Subject— she is On her way to *location_mentioned*Orleans*/location_mentioned*—for the purpose of arranging her Buisness for a permanent removal, She wishes, If possible to have *location_mentioned*land */location_mentioned*located Imediately in some good place— or so that she can be certain of It— She may probably marry in *location_mentioned*Orleans */location_mentioned*or here—and then she would loose, what was her great wish—land— any thing you can do for*person_mentioned* Mrs Reed*/person_mentioned* will Indeed greatly oblige me as I am perhaps the cause of her removal, she has many *person_mentioned*friends */person_mentioned*and I have no doubt you will be pleased— I hope you are well and all my *person_mentioned*friends*/person_mentioned*— And the *location_mentioned*Colony */location_mentioned*in a state of prosperity which is the truest wishes of my heart*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*Ro. Wilson */person_mentioned* [Rubric]*/p*
*/div1*
